entities.description: National Survey on Drug Use and Health
Dependence on nicotine, specifically cigarettes, measured using NDSS and FTND criteria.
Disorders related to the use of alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, heroin, hallucinogens, inhalants, methamphetamine, and prescription drugs.
Outcome variables related to substance use disorder.
Questions included in the NSDUH survey to measure various parameters.
Use of opioids and other prescription drugs.
Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th edition used for defining SUD.

relationships.description: NSDUH measures dependence on nicotine using NDSS and FTND criteria.
NSDUH measures substance use disorder using DSM-5 criteria.
NSDUH includes survey questions to measure various aspects like nicotine dependence and SUD.
Survey questions assess the use of illegally made fentanyl (IMF).
Survey questions assess the use of opioids and other prescription drugs.
DSM-5 is used to define substance use disorder.
NSDUH uses multiple SUD outcome variables for measuring substance use.
